website_summaries.verdict: This simple, low-cost LED is a strong performer with plenty of upfront value.
pros: The Cree 4Flow LED sports an appealingly familiar design, and offers better brightness and dimming performance than its predecessor
cons: Cree shortened its trademark 10-year warranty down to 3 years for this bulb
It's also slightly less efficient than the original

customer_reviews.title: This bulb does a great job of shedding light up AND down
customer_reviews.text: Seems brighter than a 60 watt incandescent, which is what i was looking for. This bulb does a great job of shedding light up AND down. Most LED lightbulbs that i have purchased only shoot light up, which is nice for a fixture that only goes one way, but for a lamp, you really need it to shoot down. This one does that nicely and it's bright enough for a lamp. Plus it's not a daylight bulb which is also really nice for a lamp. I like daylight LED bulbs for elsewhere in the house, but in the living room, like the soft white. Great bulb.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bluebaugh

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 1.5 years in service
customer_reviews.text: The good: nice warm light, bright and uniform; dimmable; almost the exact size of the standard bulb. The bad: out of two, one has failed after being in service for 1.5 years. We've also seen very short lifespans on Cree area floods. Since other LED bulbs seem to do just fine in our house, it doesn't appear to be our switches or the quality of the line power. Very disappointing, given they were one of the leading-edge manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Light, Higher Price, Somewhat Inefficient
customer_reviews.text: This light is great. I bought this in conjunction with a Philips SlimLine and a TCP bulb to compare the three and see which one I liked the most, and they all seem to be of about the same quality lighting. Compared to the other two, my one complaint is it has higher energy use and a higher price tag, so 4 stars. (For some reason the older, more efficient Cree model is about $2 more expensive on Amazon, which is preposterous!)
customer_reviews.author: Heirloom

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb except for the cross-ventilation design
customer_reviews.text: Just got the bulbs today and the replaced the fluorescent bulbs in the wall mounted and enclosed light fixtures outside. The light fixtures are not totally tightly enclosed so dust and bugs including spiders may get in and with the ventilation openings on the bulbs, I am sure the bugs will get in or the tiny spiders likely will start making spider webs inside the bulbs and make the bulbs not as bright over time. I don't think it's possible to try to clean out the bugs and spider webs once they got inside through the ventilation openings. Will see how long the bulbs last like that.
customer_reviews.author: Totoro

customer_reviews.title: Great light bulb and a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Seems brighter than a 75 watt bulb when new and fully exposed, but less bright when installed in a glass enclosed fixture. I don't know if this is true of all LEDs or just this one. Dim range and performance is excellent with my CFL/LED Lutron Maestro. Appearance is excellent when the bulb will be exposed, same shape and look as a regular incandescent. Color is also a very good match for incandescent bulbs. Bottom line is that on top of being cheaper than most LED 60w 2700k bulbs, this one also works better and dims properly.
customer_reviews.author: Urban Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great light output. Feels and looks like an incandescent
customer_reviews.text: Really like the soft white output of these lights. It feels and looks like an incandescent light and you don't get that cold look of some LEDs. Durability so far it's fine but they've only been used for a few months, so not a true indicator.
customer_reviews.author: Endri L

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive
customer_reviews.text: So yourself a favor and pass on this offer. Almost $6.50 for this single light is outrageous. I thought I was buying a two-pack, boy was I surprised when it arrived and I double-checked the item. The bulb itself is still a Cree, with all the quality that implies, but there are MUCH better deals out there.
customer_reviews.author: Neutrino

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs for enclosures.  Nice warm light
customer_reviews.text: The bulb is great. The light output is even and indistinguishable from an incandescent bulb (omnidirectional) and is nice and warm. I originally bought two of these for a enclosure in a closet and they have been working for many months now with no problem. I bought another one for my son's room. The bulbs do not seem to have an issue with being inside enclosures.
customer_reviews.author: MonkeyKnifeFight

customer_reviews.title: Love these bulbs - excellent incandescent replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Recently converted every bulb I own to LED. Started with these, then supplemented them with 40w equivalent bulbs and 25w equivalent chandelier bulbs, all Cree and all of which I'm very happy with. Overall great lights. Good warmth, no warm up period, and they should last a long time. And of course they use less energy than CFL, which can't compete with the lighting quality.
customer_reviews.author: K. Darling

customer_reviews.title: The plastic globe has vents to shed heat and while this looks like a conventional bulb
customer_reviews.text: Light is WAY too blue for my taste, but these bulbs work well and provide bright light. The plastic globe has vents to shed heat and while this looks like a conventional bulb, the light source inside is readily visible so the bulb's surface isn't uniformly lit like other brands. TCP makes a bulb that is lower in cost, dimmable, has longer life, and is a much more attractive looking. They are available at Home Depot or online here on Amazon for around $5 each.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Fontaine

customer_reviews.title: No good for timers
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to use this bulb in an outside porch light that is controlled by a wired in timer forget it. When the timer is off, the bulb still glows. Very strange. I tried it with a different brand LED that I had purchased in Costco, and it was fine. Checked in all three lights I planned to use them in, all the same. Another note, the picture when enlarged says assembled in USA... package I received all were Made in Mexico.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Good bulbs that are dimmable
customer_reviews.text: Bought these bulbs with the purpose of being able to dim them, based off of other reviews these seemed like the bulbs to use. These bulbs are nice and bright but when it comes to dimming, you will not see a huge difference. In fairness of the product my hanging fixture has 5 bulbs. Since I haven't tried other bulbs I don't have anything to compare these to.
customer_reviews.author: DJClev

customer_reviews.title: Nice light Ugly construction
customer_reviews.text: A great match for regular incandescent.light is a perfect warm white. The plastic casing is far superior to the precious glass construction. However, it still feels a bit flimsy when compared to the competition. My biggest gripe is the looks of this bulb. I am just not a fan. It not only feels cheap it looks cheap. It's currently hidden away in my closet so I don't have to look at it
customer_reviews.author: Dylan H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice but could be better!
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars mainly for brightness vs efficiency. 800 lumens at 11 watts is not much better than the CFL's they replaced. Still way better than incandescent, and they're dimmable, but this is cree we're talking about so I was hoping for a little more. I have another set of bulbs that are 9 watts and output 1100 lumens, but they cost about twice as much per bulb. Also a plus, I got these for $4/bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Nice 40W LED light
customer_reviews.text: These are good LED lights. I had originally installed 3 x 60W lights over our kitchen table, but it was too bright. We switched to these Cree 40W bulbs for 3 x 40 = 120W and it was a better brightness. The bulbs themselves were a bit odd in that they seem to surround the LED element with plastic and have holes in them for heat dissipation. It was just something I noticed, but otherwise these were nice lights.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: A perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: There is a certain light fixture in our kitchen that stays on all the time. It does double duty as a night light and to shed some light on a counter that often is used during the night for various purposes. This soft white light is ideal in this application. The power consumption is negligible. This is a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Dodger

customer_reviews.title: Best replacement LED bulb for an incandescent bulb on the market
customer_reviews.text: we must have gone through three different type of LED bulb styles for our historic light fixture which uses opaque glass lenses. Finally we found something which has a true omnidirectional light pattern. With the 2700k 40 watt equivalent, it looks like the incandescent bulbs these types of fixtures were meant to have. The best LED replacement in terms of light pattern for the incandescent bulb, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lito Tongson

customer_reviews.title: And I do like the rubberized coating they put on the bulbs - ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's a light bulb. When you apply the correct voltage, it lights up. Yay! Cree is doing a solid job on the price though, it must be said. And I do like the rubberized coating they put on the bulbs - much easier to get them into/out of any awkward light fittings you may have. So, a well-deserved four stars. It this was a few dollars less I would've given it five.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: This LED bulb is awesome. So lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This LED bulb is awesome. So lightweight, it doesn't tip over my little lamp at the end of the arm. And the bulb itself never gets too hot, making it safe for me to grab and reposition the metal shade. And the color of the light is very pure white. I use it on my drawing table where I do color paintings and drawings where neutral colored light is essential.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: High-Quality Light
customer_reviews.text: These light bulbs are a good deal for the $$. Not only do they produce the highest-quality LED light, they're also made in USA. Additionally, the 5000K "daylight" color helps my home to look modern, energetic, and clean.
customer_reviews.author: New Old North Columbus

customer_reviews.title: A great choice for a general purpose LED
customer_reviews.text: These lights from Cree are great. They are very light since the housing is plastic but they don't feel cheap or like they're going to fall apart. Design is an improvement over the previous with greater ventilation and better light coverage. These bulbs are slightly longer than a standard bulb. Not a problem for my fan fixture. Not perfect but pretty darn close.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: A nice looking design
customer_reviews.text: A nice looking design, looks like an incandescent at first glance. It gives good light distribution and is bright. The design relies on slot vents in the plastic bulb to allow air to cool the LED heat sinks. My only concern is that it is going to collect dust inside the plastic bulb. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Will not last!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this brand. Failure rate after three years is more than half, even in relatively low use areas. Bought about 20 total at different times from different stores so it's not just a bad batch. Other LEDs have performed fine in the house.
customer_reviews.author: JMD

customer_reviews.title: Works in enclosed fixtures
customer_reviews.text: Has been working for months in a enclosed fixture. Light is similar to an incandescent. Cheaper brands don't last long even in open fixtures. Solidly built and it's worth the extra money
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Warm light perhaps one of THE best LED bulbs at a price that is very affordable
customer_reviews.author: Lucid

customer_reviews.title: Really nice warm white point / color
customer_reviews.text: Really nice warm white point / color. Works with dimmers. It's very very very close to, but not identical to a normal lightbulb; because of this I have one light fixture this won't fit in. However it works in all my other lights.
customer_reviews.author: Brad W

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice, warm light that is easy on the eyes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this light for its color temperature. It's a nice, warm light that is easy on the eyes, especially at night. I've only had this bulb for a month so far, but it has worked well so far. Assuming it lasts a good, long time, I will definitely be buying more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Joe T.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't look like daylight
customer_reviews.text: Light bulb is OK. Some pros and some negatives. Is efficient and cost effective. I stays cool but definitely doesn't look like daylight . It's too gray and difficult for tasks like reading or detail working. It affects your vision.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like the sun...just not as hot
customer_reviews.text: I was sprised at the brightness...totally worth the money where I put it. Replaced incandescent bulbs and if they last longer than those, I'll be more surprised. I seem to go through way too many on a ceiling fan...these are a little on the big size for that purpose, but they still fit.
customer_reviews.author: J. W.

customer_reviews.title: A great replacement for outdoor enclosures
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. They stay cool and work in my enclosed outdoor fixtures as claimed. They seem brighter than 40w incandescent bulbs. The yellow light color is very much like an incandescent
customer_reviews.author: SeattleTim

customer_reviews.title: This one is great for local reading light as it produces close to ...
customer_reviews.text: This one is great for local reading light as it produces close to no heat. I got this one (Soft White) for someone else. For myself I prefer Daylight for reading (especially great for Kindle DX without backlight) and Soft White for ambient light.
customer_reviews.author: JohnDoe155

customer_reviews.title: Good price, too
customer_reviews.text: Cree is a brand I trust so selecting these was not much of a decision. Good price, too.
customer_reviews.author: John Waidner

customer_reviews.title: Just the right amount of light!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted bulbs for two lamps in my guest bedroom, and I didn't want something super bright; just enough for reading or getting up in the middle of the night. These really fit the bill! They are the same size as regular light bulbs, which I needed, but if you need something smaller keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: anner

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: This bulb burned out after 4 months, but when I called CREE Customer Service THEY VERY NICELY OFFERED A REPLACEMENT BULB AT NO CHARGE. I like that kind of customer service from friendly and helpful representatives and I give them high marks.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Anthony

customer_reviews.title: One of best I've used!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent replacement for standard incandescent bulbs. Dimmable and very warm color. I've tried many LEDs and this is my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: JConti44

customer_reviews.title: Discontinued item, too bad
customer_reviews.text: Cree doesn't make these ventilated bulbs any more. They are perfect for closed fixtures. Don't overheat. Great "incandescent" warm color.
customer_reviews.author: Foxglove

customer_reviews.title: This was one of my very favorite bulbs I tried because of how much it looks ...
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my very favorite bulbs I tried because of how much it looks like a normal bulb. Like the other LED bulbs, it's bright, they last forever and use very little power.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Shipley

customer_reviews.title: One of the nicer LED bulbs I've tried
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the nicest LED bulbs I've tried (probably have 10 different varieties. Nice warm light, smooth dimming on normal (not universal) dimmer, even light distribution.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: but good for most applications
customer_reviews.text: Not as bright as the Phillips options; but good for most applications, especially where threre's mirrors to magnify the light output. For sconces point up, it does cast shadows, so not good for vanities unless the light fixture is pointing down.
customer_reviews.author: JeffBob

customer_reviews.title: Best bulbs on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best bulbs on the market. This 4-flow design is beyond any of the competition and you have many options for brightness and light color in this collection
customer_reviews.author: braz

customer_reviews.title: Great LED bulb
customer_reviews.text: Provides a softer white light output than the 5000k and uses a lot less energy than regular incandescent bulbs. Cree is the only LED bulb I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: cpuvandy

customer_reviews.title: Good color light (warm)
customer_reviews.text: Good color light (warm). Good light disbursement (all around). Good shape/size. For general purpose lighting, this is my go-to bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Anon745

customer_reviews.title: These LED lights are great. The 5000k is good for a kitchen or ...
customer_reviews.text: These LED lights are great. The 5000k is good for a kitchen or workshop and is very industrial white light.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil Adams

customer_reviews.title: ... this bulb a few months ago and was perfectly happy with its performance -- until it simply failed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bulb a few months ago and was perfectly happy with its performance -- until it simply failed. That is, I'm happy to shell out the additional $$ for a low-watt bulb that claims to work for 25,000 hours (!!). Alas, this one only lasted for 3 months. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Simone Levine

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade at a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Light is exactly as bright and color of traditional incandescent 60w bulbs. And, no heat to contend with. Instant brightness is much better than a CFL. Great deal for the 8-pack.
customer_reviews.author: KEW824

customer_reviews.title: Great LED bulb
customer_reviews.text: Great light weight LED bulb. Size is perfect and it fits just like what I now call an old fashion bulb. I love the omni directional light distribution... way better than the LED's available years ago. I also love the daylight color.
customer_reviews.author: Jacki

customer_reviews.title: Nice bit relatively expensive by comparison at $8
customer_reviews.text: Cool Design. Thought it was flickering. But after switching out for a different led bulb the light fixture was the culprit. The incandescent didn't flicker? Any way, bulb is great but a bit expensive by comparison now.
customer_reviews.author: ponytrack

customer_reviews.title: Works great with no fixture above the kitchen sink
customer_reviews.text: Works great with no fixture above the kitchen sink. We have it on a dimmer switch and it dims beautifully. We used to have a CFL there and it would flicker with the dimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Caton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect LED bulb solution
customer_reviews.text: Tried this on a whim but was completely satisfied. They bulbs are really bright and unlike some models were an exact fit.
customer_reviews.author: humam

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 20 of these, though the last bunch I ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 20 of these, though the last bunch I got from Home Depot. All working perfectly and the light tone is not that harsh, bright bluish kind. When the bulbs are on, you can't tell it's not an incandescent bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not bright
customer_reviews.text: This bulb puts out nice light. Its not quite as bright as I expected, but the quality of the light is very nice to work by.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Runyan

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs save my a lot on my electric bill ...
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs save my a lot on my electric bill. Bill is more than half what it used to be
customer_reviews.author: brickhouse492

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Motion Sensor
customer_reviews.text: I am using this on an outdoor motion sensor light (that has a top shield). So far it has held up to all kinds of weather conditions and turns on instantly with the motion sensor of the light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: An excellent bulb. It works fine, but the venting minimizes cooling issues. I reordered for more uses.
customer_reviews.author: GeraldD

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, bright and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I bought some of these on a ridiculous add-on promotion. They were $4 each, and they are great. Very bright, and lightweight. I see the same exact bulbs in crappy home depot for $12.
customer_reviews.author: Mozambrooklyn

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs are great. Definitely the closest thing to an incandescent bulb ...
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are great. Definitely the closest thing to an incandescent bulb you'll find right now. I have noticed a SLIGHT buzz if your ear is pretty much right next to the bulb, but I can't see anybody hearing it from a reasonable distance.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I have always felt that Cree are the best for the money. I may use others, but only because I can't find the Cree I need.
customer_reviews.author: Smith-House

customer_reviews.title: Too blue
customer_reviews.text: Too blue. All the 5000k bulbs are "daylight" but it's just too blue for a home. Yes, in bright sunlight, it matches, but that's not what you want from the bulb
customer_reviews.author: Will in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: The design is great, as it throws out the light like an ...
customer_reviews.text: The design is great, as it throws out the light like an incandescent bulb. Bulb stays cool. Is quiet when dimmed.
customer_reviews.author: ClickHere

customer_reviews.title: I love LED bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I love LED bulbs. The 5000K is a bit tough on the eyes, but works out great for places like a closet or pantry where it won't be on long.
customer_reviews.author: The Stare

customer_reviews.title: It's almost like day light in my basement apartment
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs are little pricer but worth it. It's almost like day light in my basement apartment. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: nice item - interesting construct with top "vents" = will ...
customer_reviews.text: nice item - interesting construct with top "vents" = will be interested to see operation over time but a good value
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Swell lamp
customer_reviews.text: It's fine and the perfect form factor. 2700 degrees kelvin is what you want to match other tungsten color temperatures. It's just fine!
customer_reviews.author: 2-Stage

customer_reviews.title: Blue light
customer_reviews.text: I love Cree bulbs and have been using them since they first came on the market. Unfortunately these 'daylight' bulbs produce a very blue light. Would be fine in a garage, attic or as a shop light but not for most living spaces. Disappointed. Returning for soft white bulbs
customer_reviews.author: MizzouAndi

customer_reviews.title: Nice bulb, dimmed smoothly with both conventional AND X10 dimmers.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bulb, dimmed smoothly with both conventional AND X10 dimmers. Time will tell with the longevity test...
customer_reviews.author: JTB3

customer_reviews.title: LED 5,000K light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and with the 5,000K temperature light is outstanding for aging eyes (which need more light to see equally well)
customer_reviews.author: Heinz Gf Matuschka

customer_reviews.title: Loving LED bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I am really getting to like these latest LED bulbs. Bright, cool and about 1/6th the power of an equivalent incandescent.
customer_reviews.author: wild bill

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bulb. I'm very happy with the brightness and warm quality of the light.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved the pure white color. Worth the extra $$ up front if it lasts 10 years. We will see.
customer_reviews.author: xena777xena

customer_reviews.title: Cree bulb:Fail.  Amazon: Fail.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 5 pack and installed them in an outdoor lamp post on 10/30/2015. These bulbs are rated for indoor and outdoor use. The lamp post is controlled by a timer - on at dusk and off at dawn. Update 12/11/2015 - one of the bulbs is already dead. LED's are supposed to last much longer than incandescent bulbs and that's why I bought them. The lamp post is hard to access. And the bulb is no longer eligible for return through Amazon. I know that with a complain, my local big box retailer would have replaced the bulb or at the very least offered store credit. Cree bulb:Fail. Amazon: Fail.
customer_reviews.author: Happy until...

customer_reviews.title: This is the bulb for replacing your old filiment bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Can't tell it isn't a filament bulb. Other LED bulbs I have tried have a strange light output, as do the CFL's. This bulb is great.
customer_reviews.author: DLF

customer_reviews.title: Neat new type bulb
customer_reviews.text: Very (interesting bulbs. They stray cool and give good light.
customer_reviews.author: Eudice

customer_reviews.title: good bulb
customer_reviews.text: Very bright flickers on high on my dimmer. Also very pleasant warm light.
customer_reviews.author: robert mcadams

customer_reviews.title: cozy bedside light
customer_reviews.text: It has a soft glow, not bright white, and I can read by it.
customer_reviews.author: cely

customer_reviews.title: Good value for an LED lightbulb
customer_reviews.text: LED light bulb works well. Long term life remains to be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Frierson Craig

customer_reviews.title: Very nice light. I have it in a torch lamp ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice light. I have it in a torch lamp so I have indirect light. My peace lilly is loving the extra light...
customer_reviews.author: James Carter

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: A bright reliable bulb with warmish color and long life.
customer_reviews.author: vrystaat

customer_reviews.title: Buy these.
customer_reviews.text: Bulbs are as bright - or brighter - than my regular 60's and the light color is good.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: These are good light bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bulbs. Nice soft/warm light. Seem to be of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: PDX Will

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb for the money!
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs have nice light output with minimal watts. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Chris X

customer_reviews.title: Amazing light bulbs. 💡
customer_reviews.text: GREAT!!! LED light bulb. I just installed it and it really lights up the room.
customer_reviews.author: Mikael

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these bulbs. They are so bright. I replaced all the lights in my house with these.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, these are the best lights I've had, worth the extra money!!
customer_reviews.author: Ruben R. Hurtado

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice LED bulb made in the USA and great price
customer_reviews.author: jsbtmb

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as good as I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.text: Bulb had a slight green shift to the color and is dimmer like a 40 watt equivelant bulb. Other than that OK.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally an Incandescent Replacement!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally found something to replace incondescent bulbs. I use dimmers everywhere throughout the house, so flourescents were never an option. These are dimmable which is a must. The color is spot on, with an incandescent bulb. I started with one from Home Depot, loved it. Then I bought 6 from Amazon. Now I'm going to buy another 6. LED bulbs are finally here. I even use these in fixtures that have visible bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Queens, NY

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I am sure it is a good lamp from the standpoint of technology. Cree makes quality lighting. It is the outer envelope I don't like. I didn't look closely at the pictures before ordering. Since it is vented, it is subject to bugs,dust what ever to get inside and it could be a problem over the suggested 50,000 hour life span. Definitely not recommended for use in an outdoor fixture. I don't think I would order another.
customer_reviews.author: geezer11

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite LED
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are great. I've tried a number of LED bulbs and these are easily my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Mayerkelly

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: this light is bright white like a dentist's office. This is not a warm light at all.
customer_reviews.author: value shopper

customer_reviews.title: Warmest 40W LED light on the market
customer_reviews.text: I started using Cree when they first shipped the enclosed LED 40W (also comes in 60W) and I was impressed. When Home Depot received this model with the open top, the price was even lower so I tried it. Unexpectedly, the color of the light was even warmer than the closed model. It is really impressive. Also, go to the store and check because they often have either the 40W or 60W on sales for $.99 (that is right less than $1).
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bulbs and for an even greater price! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: John E. Quintanilla

customer_reviews.title: I switched 5 x 75W incandescents in a dining room ...
customer_reviews.text: I switched 5 x 75W incandescents in a dining room lamp to 5 x 60W Cree LEDs, and my wife didn't even notice (and she's always been very critical about other LED bulbs I tried). Bonus: these work with existing LED dimmer, and I even had to set it to a lower setting, because these give off more light.
customer_reviews.author: Iggy

customer_reviews.title: Great LED Replacement Bulb
customer_reviews.text: It's a light bulb. It works when I plug it in. It's bright. It has good color for an LED. It just works.
customer_reviews.author: BRENT M BAIN

customer_reviews.title: Well made but I like the warmer color version better
customer_reviews.text: For any interior lighting situation in the living spaces in my house I definitely prefer the color of the "soft light" version which I would give a full 5 stars to. Both are very well made and do not get hot. I'm using this daylight version in my garage and it's good there.
customer_reviews.author: A Coustomer

customer_reviews.title: I loved Cree lightbulbs until trying this newer type without the ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved Cree lightbulbs until trying this newer type without the heatsink. Color is too bright, bulb feels cheap, and is ugly if in an exposed light fixture. Older type felt well made and the perfect color compared to an incandescent bulb. Cannot recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: cannot be used outdoors open to weather but description says it is indoor outdoor
customer_reviews.text: the description on amazon states that this is indoor/outdoor and for damp locations. but the package says it cannot be used outdoors open to weather!
customer_reviews.author: amazonfan1

customer_reviews.title: This bulb is not as bright as I expected. ...
customer_reviews.text: This bulb is not as bright as I expected. I want a daylight bulb, but after I install it, the ligh is dim...Maybe I should choose a 60W light.
customer_reviews.author: Yi

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to see how much this bulb will lower ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to see how much this bulb will lower my electric bill. It is in a location that the lamp is on for 5 or more hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: boxr

customer_reviews.title: A great bulb for the price
customer_reviews.text: A very good led for the price. It stays really cool. The only bulb that beats it for vibrant colors is the GE Reveal.
customer_reviews.author: Northeast Consumer

customer_reviews.title: I did not like that one of these when delivered was cracked
customer_reviews.text: It's a light bulb. I did not like that one of these when delivered was cracked. Although this did not affect the performance of the bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Lazybutt

product_meta.title: Cree 60W Equivalent Soft White (2700K) A19 LED Light Bulb with 4Flow Filament Design
product_meta.description: Size:1 Pack| Style:60W Equivalent Soft White (2700K)The new Cree LED bulb looks and lights even more like a light bulb. It works just like you would expect - it lights instantly, is dimmable without buzzing and emits a warm, Omnidirectional light using just a fraction of the energy of a traditional incandescent while lasting about 25 times longer. The new Cree LED bulb is constructed from durable, shatter-proof plastic and weighs less than 2 oz. making it even more affordable so it pays for itself even quicker and will continue paying you for years. How did Cree do this, the new Cree LED Bulb replaces expensive external heat dissipation with next-generation 4Flow Filament Design using cross-flow ventilation to cool the LED. This creates a highly durable, lightweight and long-lasting bulb with a compact all-around light source, which looks and lights just like an incandescent bulb.
feature_bullets: General purpose LED bulb for every space in your home - The Cree LED Bulb looks and lights just like an incandescent bulb
60W equivalent uses only 11 Watts (82% less energy than a traditional incandescent), saving you $135 in energy costs over the life of the bulb
Lights instantly and provides an all-around, omnidirectional light distribution, just like an incandescent bulb
25,000 hours of beautiful, warm, energy-efficient light - compared to just 1,000 hours for a traditional incandescent bulb

specifications.Warranty Description: 3-years limited warranty; see package for details.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars176 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
